PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Text Search in Distributed Peer-to-Peer File Sharing System
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
Implementation of a distributed hash based algorithm for fast and efficient search in Peer-to-Peer file sharing system. 

Based on: Lal, A.; Gupta, V.; Harfoush, K. & Rhee, I. (2008), Towards feasibility and scalability of text search in peer-to-peer systems., in 'IPDPS' , IEEE, , pp. 1-8

Responsible for implementation of centralized and distributed search logic, document ranking and performance testing of the system

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Performance Study of Various TCP’s in Xen Virtualized Environment and Evaluation of Congestion Control Approaches for Performance Improvement
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
Virtualization, especially in data centers, has seen
 tremendous growth over the past decade. Most of the traffic that
 flows in the data centre networks is TCP. It was shown that virtualization impacts the performance of network
 traffic, especially TCP. This impact is due to TCP’s interpretation
 of losses (typically inferred by expiration of retransmission timer)
 in network as congestion. Resource sharing property of virtualization leads to inaccurate measurements of delays, in effect, leading to unpredictable TCP behaviour. This makes study of behavior of TCP in virtual environments very important. There
 is no comprehensive study done on behavior of various TCPs in
 virtual environment. 

This paper studies the performance of TCP Reno, Vegas, Cubic and Illinois in Xen virtualized environments and finds the best suitable congestion control mechanism for TCP in virtual networks by analysing the reason behind their different behavior.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: VMCloak – A hypervisor based solution for protection of privacy and confidentiality of application’s data from a compromised operating system
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: Using encryption as a tool, VMCloak cryptographically isolates applications in different protection domains. Thus, the code and data of sensitive applications are protected even in the case of the operating system getting compromised. Implemented in Xen Hypervisor using para‐virtualized Linux Kernel.
